meanings.definition: Not fluent or persuasive in speaking or writing.
meanings.sent1: Her ineloquent speech failed to convince anyone of her point.
meanings.sent2: The ineloquent student struggled to articulate his thoughts during the presentation.
meanings.sent3: Despite his ineloquent words, he managed to make everyone laugh with his funny gestures.
meanings.sent4: The ineloquent writer's words stumbled clumsily across the page.
meanings.sent5: The ineloquent speaker's words were like a tangled mess of yarn, impossible to unravel.

meanings.definition: Lacking eloquence or the ability to express oneself effectively.
meanings.sent1: The ineloquent poet's verses lacked the beauty and grace of more skilled writers.
meanings.sent2: She felt ineloquent when trying to describe the breathtaking sunset to her friend.
meanings.sent3: His ineloquent attempts at flirting only made her laugh.
meanings.sent4: The ineloquent painting failed to capture the emotions of the artist.
meanings.sent5: The ineloquent dancer's movements were awkward and uncoordinated on stage.
